title: Widefoot’s All New StoutCage is the Size of a Standard Bottle Cage But Stouter
content:
Widefoot proudly unveils its latest product: the StoutCage ($32). Designed with durability and versatility in mind, the StoutCage fills a niche for bottle cages in the cycling industry.

Designed for the Long Haul

The StoutCage shares the same high-quality materials and construction processes as Widefoot’s popular LiterCage, renowned for its ability to securely hold 1-liter Nalgene bottles. Cyclists who prioritize durability and versatility over weight savings will appreciate the StoutCage’s robust construction.

Standout Features

7-slot bracket for mounting flexibility: This feature allows the cage to accommodate taller bottles or half-frame bags in cramped triangles, providing you with more space and options.

Straight back to fit more bottles: The StoutCage does not have a forward bend on the top arc of the back of the cage. This design allows it to securely hold bottles of various shapes and sizes without any restrictions.

Oversized tube for extra strength: Built using the same stainless steel tubing and bracket as the LiterCage, the StoutCage effortlessly handles standard-sized cycling bottles, ensuring a secure hold without any hassle, and is built for the long haul.

Made in the USA: The StoutCage is hand-bent, brazed, and TIG-welded in-house at Widefoot in Fort Collins, Colorado, USA.

Specifications:

  • Material: Stainless Steel
  • Weight: 98g
  • Made In USA
  • MSRP: $32.00USD
